Class Critter

  • java.lang.Object
    • Critter

  • public class Critter
extends java.lang.Object
    The Critter class is the class that creates the actual critter.
    Version:
    5 06.09.15 Time Spent by Jasmine Ou: 8 hours. Time Spent by Laura Wong: 1 hour.

    name: Critter.java

    Instance variables:

    stomachAn ArrayList of Food objects that stores the food that the critter is fed.

    fullness[]An array of 3 doubles that stores the fullness level of the critter for each of the three meals.

    foodGroupCount[][]A 2D array of 3 rows and 5 columns that stores the total nutrient value of a certain food group consumed for a certain meal.

    colour This String variable is used to store the critter's colour.

    critterState This String variable is used to store the critter's state of either healthy (""), "Sick" or "Asleep".

    growthStage This String variable is used to store the level of growth the critter is at currently of either "Baby", "Teen" or "Adult".

    isHealthy This boolean variable is used to see if the critter is healthy or not.

    sickCounter This int variable is used count up to 3 unhealthy meals until the critter gets sick.

    recoverCounter This int variable is used count up to 2 healthy meals for the critter to recover.

    growthCounter This int variable is used count when the critter will grow next. The critter grows for every two meals it is healthy.

    Author:
    Jasmine Ou

    • Method Detail

      • getMessage

        public java.lang.String getMessage(int hour,
                                   int minute)
        The getMessage method gets what the critter will say depending on the time and its state. If randNum is 0. If the critter is asleep, message is set to "zZzZ". Else, if it is breakfast time and they did not eat anything for breakfast yet, message is set to "Feed me breakfast!". Else, if it is lunch time and they did not eat anything for lunch yet, message is set to "Feed me lunch!". Else, if it is dinner time and they did not eat anything for dinner yet, message is set to "Feed me dinner!". Else, if it is recreation time, message is set to "I want to play outside!". If the first if statement is false, it checks if randNum is 1. If so, the next if statement checks if the critter is starting to recover or slowly getting sick in which message is set to the appropriate message. The last else (if randNum is 3), has an if statement that checks if it is the morning and message is set to "Good Morning!". Else, if it is night, message is set to "I'm sleepy...".

        Local Variable Dictionary:

        message The String of the message that the critter will say

        randNum The integer storing a randum number to generate a randum message.

        Parameters:
        hour - is the integer to store the hour number.
        minute - is the integer to store the minute number.
        Returns:
        message is the String that the critter will say.

      • newDay

        public void newDay()
        The newDay method refreshes the variables for a new day. The first for loop starts from 0, runs while less than 3 and increments by one each time. The second for loop starts from 0, runs while less than 6 and increments by one each time. Those two for loops is to assign 0 to all the locations of the 2D array foodGroupCount.

        Local Variable Dictionary:

        x The integer loop variable that starts from 0, runs while less than 3 and increments by one each time.

        y The integer loop variable that starts from 0, runs while less than 6 and increments by one each time.

      • newLevel

        public void newLevel()
        The newLevel method resets variabes to start a new level.

      • calcPercentage

        public double calcPercentage(int meal,
                             int foodGroup)
        The calcPercentage method calculates the percentage of consumption for a foodGroup compared to the their fullness for the meal.

        Local Variable Dictionary:

        percentage The double value of the percentage of the foodGroupCount to the total fullness.

        Parameters:
        meal - is the integer that stores the meal number where 0 is breakfast, 1 is lunch and 2 is dinner.
        foodGroup - is the integer that stores the foodGroup number where O is fruits and vegetables, 1 is grains, 2 is dairy, 3 is protein, 4 is sugars and fats and 5 is water.
        Returns:
        percentage which is the double value of the percentage.

      • getFoodGroupCount

        public double getFoodGroupCount(int meal,
                                int foodGroup)
        The getFoodGroupCount method returns the integer foodGroupCount for the specified meal and food group.
        Parameters:
        meal - is the integer that stores the meal number where 0 is breakfast, 1 is lunch and 2 is dinner.
        foodGroup - is the integer that stores the foodGroup number where O is fruits and vegetables, 1 is grains, 2 is dairy, 3 is protein, 4 is sugars and fats and 5 is water.
        Returns:
        foodGroupCount[][] which is the double that stores the total nutrient value of a foodGroup consumed for one specific meal.

      • setFoodGroupCount

        public void setFoodGroupCount(double nutrientValue,
                              int meal,
                              int foodGroup)
        The setFoodGroupCount method adds nutrientValue to the foodGroupCount for a specific meal and foodGroup.
        Parameters:
        nutrientValue - is the double value that stores how much the food item will fill the critter up.
        meal - is the integer that stores the meal number where 0 is breakfast, 1 is lunch and 2 is dinner.
        foodGroup - is the integer that stores the foodGroup number where O is fruits and vegetables, 1 is grains, 2 is dairy, 3 is protein, 4 is sugars and fats and 5 is water..
